DataElement.preferredName: RT ROI Observation Label DICOM Short String Text

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A specific area of interest defined by a sequence of image overlays or a sequence of contours described as a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing an open or closed polygon)._Observation; watching something and taking note of what happens._A brief description given for purposes of identification; an identifying or descriptive marker that is attached to an object.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Imaging Region of Interest Observation
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A specific area of interest defined by a sequence of image overlays or a sequence of contours described as a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing an open or closed polygon).:Observation; watching something and taking note of what happens.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

A specific area of interest defined by a sequence of image overlays or a sequence of contours described as a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing and open or closed polygon).
Watching something and taking note of what happens.

Property.preferredDefinition: A brief description given for purposes of identification; an identifying or descriptive marker that is attached to an object.

Concepts.definition: A brief description given for purposes of identification; an identifying or descriptive marker that is attached to an object.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/18/19 jk DICOM CDE; Released per qtrly metric review.  12/11/13 created for DICOM RT content. jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: SH:  DICOM Short String; A character string that may be padded with leading and/or trailing spaces. The character code 05CH (the BACKSLASH "/" in ISO-IR 6) shall not be present, as it is used as the delimiter between values for multiple data elements. The string shall not have Control Characters except ESC.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.:Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.:An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.
Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.
An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 11/18/19 jk DICOM CDE; Released per qtrly metric review.  12/9/13-Create for CDEs using the DICOM SH VR type; based on 2011 DICOM Standard, section 5. 3.16.20 Removed special characters for MDR data migration. mc
